'''Catapults''' were siege engines used for casting missiles.<ref name=":0">{{Cite DTP|id=LR 5.04.142}}</ref>

During the [[Siege of Gondor|siege of Minas Tirith]] the [[Morgul-host]]<ref>{{App|Great}}, entry for 10 March 3019</ref> led by the [[Witch-king]] set up great catapults,<ref name=":1">{{Cite DTP|id=LR 5.04.139}}</ref> which were used to throw into the first circle of [[Minas Tirith]] both flaming missiles<ref name=":0" /> to cause fires<ref name=":2">{{Cite DTP|id=LR 5.04.143}}</ref> and severed heads of fallen [[Gondorians]]<ref name=":2" /> to cause dread and despair.<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR 5.04.144}}</ref> Gondorians also had similar engines upon the [[City Wall|walls]] of Minas Tirith, but they were smaller and couldn't reach catapults of the enemy.<ref name=":1" /> It is possible that these Gondorian catapults were later used to crush or set aflame siege towers used by the besiegers.<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR 5.04.186}}</ref>

==Portrayal in adaptations==
'''2003: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King]]'':'''
:The Morgul-host uses catapults, operated by [[Orcs]] and [[Trolls]]. They launch both severed heads of Gondorian soldiers and flaming missiles (as in the book), but also stone missiles, able to damage the walls of Minas Tirith.
:Gondorians use [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trebuchet trebuchets], which launch pieces of broken walls instead of dedicated missiles. They are used successfully to destroy several siege towers of the enemy.
